title: Terminal Operator
description:
Are you ready for a new challenge?
Fantastic opportunity to join one of the world's leading oil and gas companies.
Join our Wellington team, as we are on the hunt for a 
Terminal Operator.
The organization is the oldest and most renowned oil company in New Zealand, operating in over 150 locations all over the country.
You'll be a key part of the operations team to ensure the terminal runs efficiently, reliably, safely and cost effectively.
 
You'll be responsible for:
Performing activities related to the receipt and shipping of all products and additives
Performing functions relating to site operations, ensuring the reliability of equipment and the supply and delivery system sun smoothly 
Operate, maintain and repair site facilities in a safe, efficient, cost effective and environmentally sound manner
Managing and coordinating contractors and drivers with respect to safety, orientation and compliance
Acts as main contact/liaison between the Control Centre, the TOU and site operations
Interfaces directly with the measurement specialist, ISU, and third party personnel for inventory management and measurement
Assists with mechanical and operational activities 
Recommends upgrades and adjustments to maintenance plans
Flawless execution of the work permitting process
About the role:
Full time 40h a week
Based in Seaview Terminal
Competitive hourly rate
Ongoing role-no end date
Great career opportunity
We're ideally seeking for:
Minimum 5 years' experience as a Terminal Operator
High-level working knowledge of measurement practices
Good mechanical aptitude
Demonstrated leadership skills
Strong computer skills, including Excel and Word
Secondary/ High School Diploma or college level degree
Minimum 100% of assigned Stage 3 Training per GMT Standards
In depth knowledge of the applicable rules, regulations and standards for the operation
Very good interpersonal skills
Excellent negotiation and communication skills
Ability to works independently
Valid Driver's License
This is an awesome opportunity to join a global team and take the next step in your career! 
If this sounds like you, don't hesitate to
 APPLY NOW!
Any queries or further information, please email: 
Thania.kristiansen@persolkelly.co.nz
 with a copy of your CV.
Who are we
At PERSOLKELLY, our passion is - and always has been - putting you first.
We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.
We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.
We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.
So it's over to you. If you would like to join our team, please APPLY now.
To learn more about working with PERSOLKELLY, we encourage you to visit our website.
